result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon F. Bubla

records.addlTxt:
8:33 AM Defendant Jonathon F. Bubla not in court.  Attorney Richard E. Bender appeared by video for Jonathon F. Bubla.  Attorney Cass W Cousins in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DA Cousins calls cases 21CF32, 21CF38, 21CF88, 21CF299, 21CT28, 22CM1 and states appearances.
DA Cousins notes the non-appearance of the defendant and states he was transferred to Dodge Correctional and is not here for the hearing.
Court states that this matter will need to be rescheduled and that his assistant will contact the parties to do so.

BY THE COURT:
Matter to be rescheduled.
Judge Nicholas J. Brazeau Jr. assigned

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 3:09 PM Defendant Jonathon F. Bubla in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard E. Bender in court for Jonathon F. Bubla. Case 21CF299 Preliminary Hearing. Defendant wishes judge to have different judge. Judge recuses himself.

1:34 PM Defendant Jonathon F. Bubla appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard E. Bender appeared by video for Jonathon F. Bubla.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 21CT28, 22CM1 and 21CF299.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered on the 21CT28 and 22CM1.
21CF299: Preliminary Time limits are not waived.
BY THE COURT:  Bonds continued.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Cash bond covers all cases: 21CF-32, 21CF-38, 21CF-88, 21CF-299, 21CT-28 and 22CM-1.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
No Contact with Kwik Trips in Portage County,  Papa Joe's Bar and Bill's Pizza

Defendant Jonathon F. Bubla appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard are 21CF-32, 21CF-38, 21CF-88, 21CF-299, 21CT-28 and 22CM-1. 

11:41 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Defendant appears pro se.
Matters are set for return on warrant.

State requests warrant be quashed.

BY THE COURT:
Warrants are quashed.

Court reviews the files.
Defendant addresses the Court, requests all cases to be consolidated and moved to another state.
Court replies.

Court advises Defendant to contact the public defender.
Some of the cases had an initial appearance.

21CT-28, 22CM-1 and 21CF-299 need initial appearances be set : September 6th at 1:15 PM, Br 2. 

Bonds have been set on all cases.
State is requesting bond modifications. 

21CF-32, 21CF-38 and 21CF-88 need pretrial conferences be set: September 19th at 9:30 AM, Br 1.

State requests $5000 cash bond to cover all six cases.

State has complied with victim notification statutes. 
Victims are not present.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant replies.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

02:14 PM Defendant Jonathon F. Bubla not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Cassidy requests a warrant with a body only warrant for the reasons stated. 
Court questions Atty Cassidy if the other warrants are also body only warrants. 
Court reviews the file.  
Atty Cassidy makes additional arguments for the body only warrant. 

BY THE COURT:  Warrant with a $500 cash alternative.
Initial Appearance set for February 28, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 1
